main event: On January 6, 1961, an observer witnessed a circular object emitting a pinkish orange glow northwest of Humboldt, Kansas.
interesting points: The object hovered above a pasture for about one hour and 45 minutes,The object appeared to be the size of a large automobile,The observer saw the object accelerate rapidly and disappear in 10 to 12 seconds,The USAF investigated the sighting and attributed it to weather inversion,The witness remains unconvinced by the official explanation.
sighted object: a circular object emitting a pinkish orange glow
witness description: The witness described the object as hover and emitting a pinkish orange glow, and as large as a car.
